title: Workshop: How to Draw in Museums—Drawing the Hairy Who, Part I
hero_caption: Jim Falconer, Art Green, Gladys Nilsson, Jim Nutt, Suellen Rocca, and Karl Wirsum. Hairy Who, 1966. Gift of Gladys Nilsson and Jim Nutt.
short_description: Part one of a two-part program presented with the Smart Museum of Art.
list_description: Part one of a two-part program presented with the Smart Museum of Art.
description:
Pick up a sketchbook and pencil and learn secret techniques from an incredible group of Chicago artists who got their start in Hyde Park, the Hairy Who. Part I of this two-part program begins with an in-gallery drawing exercise and a deep dive tour of a masterful painting by Suellen Rocca as well vintage Hyde Park Art Center posters and comix on view in the Smart Museum's exhibition The Time Is Now! Then, draw and sketch motifs and Hairy Who-inspired tattoo designs for use in Part II at the Art Institute of Chicago.

This program is open to all skill levels and materials will be provided. Space is limited and registration is required.

Presented by the Smart Museum of Art and the Art Institute of Chicago.
